summary: This is an email exchange between attorney Robert C. Josefsberg and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The AUSA offers counseling and victim services to Josefsberg's clients (presumably victims in the Epstein case) and provides contact information for a case agent. Josefsberg acknowledges the offer and states he will inform his clients.

persons.name: Robert C. Josefsberg
persons.context: Attorney who receives an offer of victim services from the AUSA and states he will attempt to contact his clients about the offer.

persons.name: Bob
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York who emails Robert Josefsberg to remind him that victim counseling and services are available through the FBI case agent.

connections.description: Email exchange regarding victim services for Josefsberg's clients in the Epstein case.
Josefsberg states he will attempt to contact each of his clients regarding the offer of victim services.
The AUSA references a Special Agent as the case agent who can connect victims to services.

events.title: Offer of victim services communicated
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails attorney Robert Josefsberg to remind him that counseling and victim services are available for his clients through the FBI case agent.

keyFacts: In August 2019, the U.S. Attorney's Office was proactively reaching out to attorneys representing Epstein victims to offer counseling and victim services.
Attorney Robert C. Josefsberg was representing multiple clients who were victims in the Epstein case.
The communication indicates ongoing efforts by law enforcement to provide support to victims during a 'complicated and stressful time'.
A specific FBI Special Agent was designated as the case agent to coordinate victim services.
The email characterizes the overall Epstein situation as 'bizarre'.
